sen.j: 清凉寺（せいりょうじ）は、京都府京都市右京区嵯峨野 にある浄土宗の寺院。
sen.e: Seiryo-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Pure Land sect located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Seiryo-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Pure Land sect located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Seiryo-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Pure Land sect located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号を五台山（ごだいさん）と称する。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Godaisan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Godaisan.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を補足。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Godaisan.'

sen.j: 嵯峨釈迦堂（さがしゃかどう）の名で知られ、中世以来「融通念仏の道場」としても知られている。
sen.e: It is known as Saga Shaka-do and, from the middle ages, has also been referred to as the 'Place of Yuzu-Nembutsu Enlightenment'.
It is known as Saga Shaka-do and, from the middle ages, has also been referred to as the 'Place of Yuzu-Nembutsu Enlightenment.'
It is known as Saga Shaka-do and, from the middle ages, has also been referred to as the 'Place of Yuzu-Nembutsu Enlightenment.'

sen.j: 宗派は初め華厳宗、後に浄土宗となる。
sen.e: Initially, the temple belonged to the Kegon sect before becoming a Pure Land sect temple.
Initially, the temple belonged to the Kegon sect before becoming a Pure Land sect temple.
Initially, the temple belonged to the Kegon sect before becoming a Pure Land sect temple.

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来、開基（創立者）はちょう然（ちょうねん）、開山（初代住職）はその弟子の盛算（じょうさん）である。
sen.e: The temple's object of devotion is Shaka Nyorai and was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) Chonen, with his student Josan serving as kaisan (founding priest).
sen.cmt: ・Shaka Nyorai: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding）: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: The temple's object of devotion is Shaka Nyorai and was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) Chonen, with his student Josan serving as kaisan (founding priest).
The temple's object of devotion is Shaka Nyorai and was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) Chonen, with his student Josan serving as kaisan (founding priest).

sen.j: 起源と歴史
sen.e: Origin and History
Origin and History
Origin and History

sen.j: 棲霞寺
sen.e: Seika-ji Temple
Seika-ji Temple
Seika-ji Temple

sen.j: この寺の歴史には、阿弥陀三尊を本尊とする棲霞寺（せいかじ）と、釈迦如来を本尊とする清凉寺という2つの寺院が関係している。
sen.e: Both Seika-ji Temple, devoted to Amida sanzon, and Seiryo-ji Temple, devoted to Shaka Nyorai, are connected to the history of this temple.
Both Seika-ji Temple, devoted to Amida sanzon, and Seiryo-ji Temple, devoted to Shaka Nyorai, are connected to the history of this temple.
Both Seika-ji Temple, devoted to Amida sanzon, and Seiryo-ji Temple, devoted to Shaka Nyorai, are connected to the history of this temple.

sen.j: この地には、もともと、嵯峨天皇の皇子・左大臣源融（みなもとのとおる、822年 - 895年）の別荘・栖霞観（せいかかん）があった。
sen.e: This site was originally the location of a villa named 'Seikakan' belonging to Imperial Prince and Minister of the Left MINAMOTO no Toru (822-895), son of Emperor Saga.
sen.cmt: ・Emperor Saga: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)
sen.e: This site was originally the location of a villa named 'Seikakan' belonging to Imperial Prince and Minister of the Left MINAMOTO no Toru (822-895), son of Emperor Saga.
This site was originally the location of a villa named Seikakan belonging to Imperial Prince and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Toru (822-895), son of Emperor Saga.
sen.cmt: 原文に「」のない' 'を削除"Minister of the Left"→"Sadaijin (Minister of the Left)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 源融の一周忌に当たる寛平8年（896年）、融が生前に造立発願して果たせなかった阿弥陀三尊像を子息が造り、これを安置した阿弥陀堂を棲霞寺と号した。
sen.e: In the year 896, on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru, his son fulfilled the unachieved ambition of his father by creating a statue of Amida sanzon and installing it in the Amida hall that he named Seika-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ・Amida sanzon: http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/a/amidasanzon.htm・Amida hall: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: In the year 896, on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru, his son fulfilled the unachieved ambition of his father by creating a statue of Amida sanzon and installing it in the Amida hall that he named Seika-ji Temple.

In the year 896, on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru, his son fulfilled the unachieved ambition of his father by creating a statue of Amida sanzon and installing it in the Amida hall that he named Seika-ji Temple.

sen.j: その後天慶8年（945年）に、重明親王妃が新堂を建て、等身大の釈迦像を安置した。
sen.e: In the year 945, the wife of Imperial Prince Shigeakira founded a new hall and installed within a life-sized statue of Shaka Nyorai.
sen.cmt: ・Imperial Prince Shigeakira: 英辞郎 on the WEB (-親王)
sen.e: In the year 945, the wife of Imperial Prince Shigeakira founded a new hall and installed within a life-sized statue of Shaka Nyorai.
In the year 945, the wife of Imperial Prince Shigeakira founded a new hall and installed within a life-sized statue of Shaka Nyorai.

sen.j: 一説では、「釈迦堂」の名の起こりはこの時であるという。
sen.e: One theory claims this to be the origin of the name 'Shaka-do' (Shaka Hall)
One theory claims this to be the origin of the name 'Shaka-do' (Shaka Hall).
One theory claims this to be the origin of the name 'Shaka-do' (Shaka Hall).

sen.j: 清凉寺
sen.e: Seiryo-ji Temple
Seiryo-ji Temple
Seiryo-ji Temple

sen.j: 棲霞寺草創から数十年後、当時の中国・北宋に渡り、五台山 (中国)（一名、清凉山）を巡礼した奝然（ちょうねん、938－1016）という東大寺出身の僧がいた。
sen.e: Several decades after the founding of Seika-ji Temple, there lived a monk from Todai-ji Temple named Chonen who travelled to Northern Song Period China on a pilgrimage to Mt. Wutai (also known as Mt. Qingliang).

Several decades after the founding of Seika-ji Temple, there lived a monk from Todai-ji Temple named Chonen who travelled to Northern Song Period China on a pilgrimage to Mt. Wutai (also known as Mt. Qingliang).

Several decades after the founding of Seika-ji Temple, there lived a monk from Todai-ji Temple named Chonen (938-1016) who travelled to Northern Song Period China on a pilgrimage to Mt. Wutai (also known as Mt. Qingliang).

sen.j: 奝然は、宋へ渡航中の985年、台州の開元寺で現地の仏師に命じて1体の釈迦如来像を謹刻させた。
sen.e: In the year 985, while in China, Chonen appointed Buddhist artisans of Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou to carve of a statue of Shaka Nyorai.
In the year 985, while in Song China, Chonen appointed Buddhist artisans of Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou to carve of a statue of Shaka Nyorai.
In the year 985, while in Song China, Chonen appointed Buddhist artisans of Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou to carve of a statue of Shaka Nyorai.

sen.j: その釈迦像は、古代インドの優填王（うてんおう）が釈迦の在世中に栴檀（せんだん）の木で造らせたという由緒を持つ霊像を模刻したもので、実は模刻像と霊像とが入れ替わったとする縁起を持つため、「インド - 中国 - 日本」と伝来したことから「三国伝来の釈迦像」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: This Shaka Nyorai statue is said to be a copy of an actual likeness made from sandalwood commissioned by the Indian King Udayana during Shaka's lifetime and, for this reason, is also called the "three nation Shaka statue" due its transmission from India to China and then to Japan.

This Shaka Nyorai statue is said to be a copy of an actual likeness made from chinaberry commissioned by the Indian King Udayana during Shaka's lifetime and have the history that two statues changed places, for this reason, is also called the 'three nation Shaka statue' due its transmission from India to China and then to Japan.
sen.cmt: ""→ ''に訂正。栴檀→chinaberry ※sandalwoodは白檀原文の、"模刻像と霊像とが入れ替わったとする縁起を持つため"が訳されていない為、英訳し補足。
sen.e: This Shaka Nyorai statue is said to be a copy of an actual likeness made from chinaberry commissioned by the Indian King Udayana during Shaka's lifetime and have the history that two statues changed places, for this reason, is also called the 'three nation Shaka statue' due its transmission from India to China and then to Japan.

sen.j: 奝然は、永延元年（987年）日本に帰国後、京都の愛宕山を中国の五台山に見立て、愛宕山麓にこの釈迦像を安置する寺を建立しようとした。
sen.e: After returning to Japan in the year 987, Chonen likened Kyoto's Mt. Atago-yama to Mt. Wutai in China and attempted to establish a temple at its base in which to install the Shaka statue.
After returning to Japan in the year 987, Chonen likened Kyoto's Mt. Atago-yama to Mt. Wutai in China and attempted to establish a temple at its base in which to install the Shaka statue.
After returning to Japan in the year 987, Chonen likened Kyoto's Mt. Atago-yama to Mt. Wutai in China and attempted to establish a temple at its base in which to install the Shaka statue.

sen.j: 奝然は、三国伝来の釈迦像をこの嵯峨の地に安置することで、南都系の旧仏教の都における中心地としようとしたものと思われる。
sen.e: It is believed that Chonen chose to install the Shaka statue at this Saga site as the centre the southern capital of Buddhism.
It is believed that Chonen chose to install the Shaka statue at this Saga site as the centre the southern capital of Buddhism.
It is believed that Chonen chose to install the three nation Shaka statue at this Saga site as the center of the southern capital of Buddhism.
sen.cmt: the three nation補足centre→centercenter the の間にof補足

sen.j: すなわち、都の西北方にそびえる愛宕山麓の地に拠点となる清凉寺を建立することで、相対する都の東北方に位置する比叡山延暦寺と対抗しようとした、という意図が込められていたとされる。
sen.e: It is thought that intended to establish Seiryo-ji Temple at the base of Mt. Atago-yama in the northeast of the capital in order to counteract the corresponding Enryaku-ji Temple situated at Mt. Hieizan in the northeast.

It is thought that intended to establish Seiryo-ji Temple at the base of Mt. Atago-yama in the northwest of the capital in order to counteract the corresponding Enryaku-ji Temple situated at Mt. Hieizan in the northeast.

It is thought that intended to establish Seiryo-ji Temple at the base of Mt. Atago-yama in the northwest of the capital in order to counteract the corresponding Enryaku-ji Temple situated at Mt. Hieizan in the northeast.

sen.j: しかし、その願いを達しないまま長和5年（1016年）、奝然は没した。
sen.e: However, Chonen's ambition was not realized and he passed away in 1016.
However, Chonen's ambition was not realized and he passed away in 1016.
However, Chonen's ambition was not realized and he passed away in 1016.

sen.j: かれの遺志を継いだ弟子の盛算（じょうさん）が棲霞寺の境内に建立したのが、五台山清凉寺である。
sen.e: On receiving his master's dying wish, Chonen's disciple Josan went on to found Godaisan Seiryo-ji Temple.
On receiving his master's dying wish, Chonen's disciple Josan went on to found Godaisan Seiryo-ji Temple.
On receiving his master's dying wish, Chonen's disciple Josan went on to found Godaisan Seiryo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 大念仏(融通念仏)
sen.e: Dai-Nembutsu (Yuzu-Nembutsu)
Dai-Nembutsu (Yuzu-Nembutsu)
Dai-Nembutsu (Yuzu-Nembutsu)

sen.j: 融通念仏との結びつきができたのは、弘安2年（1279年）以降のことである。
sen.e: The temple's link to Yuzu-Nembutsu came about after 1279.
The temple's link to Yuzu-Nembutsu came about after 1279.
The temple's link to Yuzu-Nembutsu came about after 1279.

sen.j: この年、大念仏中興上人と呼ばれる円覚が、当寺で融通念仏を勤修している。
sen.e: In this year, an enlightened monk named Dai-Nembutsu Chuko Shonin practiced Yuzu-Nembutsu at the temple.
In this year, Enkaku, an enlightened monk named Dai-Nembutsu Chuko Shonin practiced Yuzu-Nembutsu at the temple.
In this year, Enkaku, an enlightened monk named Dai-Nembutsu Chuko Shonin practiced Yuzu-Nembutsu at the temple.

sen.j: その後、当寺で大念仏が盛んになり、融通念仏の道場となった。
sen.e: Dai-Nembutsu went on to flourish on the site and it became known as a place of Yuzu-Nembutsu enlightenment.
Dai-Nembutsu went on to flourish on the site and it became known as a place of Yuzu-Nembutsu enlightenment.
Dai-Nembutsu went on to flourish on the site and it became known as a place of Yuzu-Nembutsu enlightenment.

sen.j: 大念仏狂言が初めて執行されたのは、下って嘉吉3年（1443年）のこととされる。
sen.e: Dai-Nembutsu plays are thought have been first performed at the temple in 1443.
Dai-Nembutsu plays are thought have been first performed at the temple in 1443.
Dai-Nembutsu plays are thought to have been first performed at the temple in 1443.

sen.j: その後、応仁の乱で本寺の伽藍は焼失するが、文明 (日本)13年（1481年）に再興された。
sen.e: The temple's monastery was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but was rebuilt in 1481.
The temple's monastery was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but was rebuilt in 1481.
The temple's monastery was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but was rebuilt in 1481.

sen.j: 出開帳
sen.e: Dekaicho
Dekaicho
Dekaicho

sen.j: 享禄3年（1530年）に円誉が当寺に入り、初めて十二時の念仏を勤修してより、本寺は浄土宗の寺となる。
sen.e: In 1530, it became a Pure Land sect temple after En'yo entered the temple and conducted the first noon prayers to Amitaba.
In 1530, it became a Pure Land sect temple after En'yo entered the temple and conducted the first noon prayers to Amitaba.
In 1530, it became a Pure Land sect temple after Enyo entered the temple and conducted the first noon prayers to Amitaba.

sen.j: 釈迦堂（本堂）は、慶長7年（1602年）に豊臣秀頼によって寄進・造営されたが、その後、嵯峨の大火が類焼し、本堂以下の伽藍は被災し、また、大地震の被害もあり伽藍の破損は甚大となる。
sen.e: The Shaka-do (hondo) was donated by Hideyori TOYOTOMI in 1602 but a great fire spread throughout Saga, causing damage to the monastery below, which was compounded by damage inflicted by a large earthquake.

The Shaka-do (hondo) was donated by Hideyori TOYOTOMI in 1602 but a great fire spread throughout Saga, causing damage to the monastery below, which was compounded by damage inflicted by a large earthquake.

The Shaka-do (hondo) was donated by Hideyori TOYOTOMI in 1602 but a great fire spread throughout Saga, causing damage to the monastery below, which was compounded by damage inflicted by a large earthquake.

sen.j: 元禄13年（1700年）より、本尊の江戸に始まる各地への出開帳が始まる。
sen.e: In 1700, the statue of the principal deity began to be taken out and displayed at various locations in what is known as 'dekaicho'.
In 1700, the statue of the principal deity began to be taken out and displayed, starting in Edo and at various locations in what is known as 'dekaicho.'
sen.cmt: 「江戸に始まる」を補足。ピリオドを''内に移動。
sen.e: In 1700, the statue of the principal deity began to be taken out and displayed, starting in Edo and at various locations in what is known as dekaicho.

sen.j: また、徳川綱吉の母である桂昌院の発願で、伽藍の復興がおこなわれた。
sen.e: In addition, restoration of the monastery was carried out in accordance with the wish of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA's mother Keishoin.
In addition, restoration of the monastery was carried out in accordance with the wish of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA's mother Keishoin.
In addition, restoration of the monastery was carried out in accordance with the wish of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA's mother Keishoin.

sen.j: このように、三国伝来の釈迦像は信仰を集め、清凉寺は「嵯峨の釈迦堂」と呼ばれて栄えた。
sen.e: These events resulted in the three nation Shaka statue becoming increasingly revered and Seiryo-ji Temple being referred to as 'Saga Shaka-do'.
These events resulted in the three nation Shaka statue becoming increasingly revered and Seiryo-ji Temple being referred to as 'Saga Shaka-do.'
These events resulted in the three nation Shaka statue becoming increasingly revered and Seiryo-ji Temple being referred to as 'Saga Shaka-do.'

sen.j: 一方、母体であった棲霞寺は次第に衰微したが、今に残る阿弥陀堂や、阿弥陀三尊像（国宝、現在は霊宝館に安置）に、その名残りをとどめる。
sen.e: On the other hand, the original Seika-ji Temple gradually fell into decline and the surviving Amida Hall and Amida sanzon statue (National Treasure now installed in Reihokan) are its last remaining traces.
sen.cmt: ・Amida hall: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・Amida sanzon: http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/a/amidasanzon.htm・Shaka Nyorai: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: On the other hand, the original Seika-ji Temple gradually fell into decline and the surviving Amida Hall and Amida sanzon statue (National Treasure now installed in Reihokan) are its last remaining traces.

On the other hand, the original Seika-ji Temple gradually fell into decline and the surviving Amida Hall and Amida sanzon statue (National Treasure now installed in Reihokan) are its last remaining traces.

sen.j: 伽藍
sen.e: Monastery
Monastery
Monastery

sen.j: 「五台山」の額が掛かる仁王門を入ると、正面に三国伝来の釈迦像を安置する本堂（釈迦堂）があり、本堂の東側には、旧棲霞寺本尊の阿弥陀三尊像を安置していた（現在は霊宝館に安置）阿弥陀堂が、通例の阿弥陀堂とは逆に、本尊が西を向く形で配置されている。
sen.e: Entering the main Nio-mon gate; straight ahead is the main hall (Shaka Hall) housing the statue of Shaka Nyorai and to the east of the main hall is Amida Hall that once housed the former Seika-ji Temple principal image Amida Sanzon (now within in Reihokan), which, contrary to custom, is situated so that the statue would have been facing westward.
sen.cmt: ・Amida hall: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・Amida sanzon: http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/a/amidasanzon.htm・Shaka Nyorai: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: Entering the main Nio-mon gate; straight ahead is the main hall (Shaka Hall) housing the statue of Shaka Nyorai and to the east of the main hall is Amida Hall that once housed the former Seika-ji Temple principal image Amida Sanzon (now within in Reihokan), which, contrary to custom, is situated so that the statue would have been facing westward.

Entering the main Nio-mon gate with a frame of 'Wutaishan' hanging; straight ahead is the main hall (Shaka Hall) housing the statue of Shaka Nyorai and to the east of the main hall is Amida Hall that once housed the former Seika-ji Temple principal image Amida Sanzon (now within in Reihokan), which, contrary to custom, is situated so that the statue would have been facing westward.
sen.cmt: with a frame of 'Wutaishan' hanging の訳を補足

sen.j: また、本堂西側には南向きの薬師寺がある。
sen.e: To the west of the main hall is the south-facing Yakushi-ji Temple.
To the west of the main hall is the south-facing Yakushi-ji Temple.
To the west of the main hall is the south-facing Yakushi-ji Temple.

sen.j: 現在の本堂は元禄14年（1701年）、阿弥陀堂は文久3年（1863年）の再建である。
sen.e: The current main hall was rebuilt in 1701 and the Amida Hall was rebuilt in 1863.
The current main hall was rebuilt in 1701 and the Amida Hall was rebuilt in 1863.
The current main hall was rebuilt in 1701 and the Amida Hall was rebuilt in 1863.

sen.j: 仁王門から本堂への参道の西側には法華経に由来する多宝塔、法隆寺夢殿を模した聖徳太子殿、狂言堂などがある。
sen.e: On the western side of the sando (entrance path) leading from the Nio-mon gate to the main hall are various buildings including the Tahoto tower based on the Lotus Sutra, the Shotoku-taishi-den recreating the Horyu-ji Temple Yumedono and Kyogen-do.
sen.cmt: ・sando (entrance path): http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・Lotus Sutra: プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: On the western side of the sando (entrance path) leading from the Nio-mon gate to the main hall are various buildings including the Tahoto tower based on the Lotus Sutra, the Shotoku-taishi-den recreating the Horyu-ji Temple Yumedono and Kyogen-do.

On the western side of the sando (entrance path) leading from the Nio-mon gate to the main hall are various buildings including the Tahoto tower based on the Lotus Sutra, the Shotoku-taishi-den recreating the Horyu-ji Temple Yumedono and Kyogen-do.

sen.j: 狂言堂は、春の大念仏の季節には賑わいを見せる。
sen.e: Kyogen-do becomes busy during the spring Dai-Nembutsu season.
Kyogen-do becomes busy during the spring Dai-Nembutsu season.
Kyogen-do becomes busy during the spring Dai-Nembutsu season.

sen.j: 参道を挟んだ東側には、堂の正面に傅大士（ふだいし）父子像が安置された一切経蔵（輪蔵）がある。
sen.e: On the eastern side of the sando is the Issai Kyozo (Rinzo) with statue of Fu Dashi and his son installed on the front.
On the eastern side of the sando is the Issai Kyozo (Rinzo) with statue of Fu Dashi and his son installed on the front.
On the eastern side of the sando is the Issai Kyozo (Rinzo) with statue of Fu Dashi and his son installed on the front.

sen.j: 境内には以上の他、宝物を収蔵展示する霊宝館、法然上人求道青年像、豊臣秀頼首塚などがある。
sen.e: As well as those buildings given above, the precinct also includes the Reihokan which houses and exhibits precious artifacts such as a statue of a young Honen Shonin seeking enlightenment and a burial mound containing the head of Hideyori TOYOTOMI.

As well as those buildings given above, the precinct also includes the Reihokan which houses and exhibits precious artifacts such as a statue of a young Honen Shonin seeking enlightenment and a burial mound containing the head of Hideyori TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 文化財
sen.e: Cultural Properties
Cultural Properties
Cultural Properties

tit.cmt: ・National Treasures: プログレッシブ和英中辞典

sen.j: 木造釈迦如来立像および像内納入品－「起源と歴史」の項で述べた、いわゆる「三国伝来の釈迦像」である。
sen.e: Wooden standing image of Shaka and objects contained within - This is the "three nation Shaka statue" referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.
Wooden standing image of Shaka and objects contained within - This is the 'three nation Shaka statue' referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.
Wooden standing image of Shaka and objects contained within - This is the 'three nation Shaka statue' referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.

sen.j: 像高約160cmで、魏氏桜桃という日本にはない材で作られているという。
sen.e: It is 160cm tall and said to be made from the wood of the Prunus Wilsoni Koehne tree not found in Japan.
It is 160cm tall and said to be made from the wood of the Prunus Wilsoni Koehne tree not found in Japan.
It is 160 cm tall and said to be made from the wood of the Prunus Wilsoni Koehne tree not found in Japan.

sen.j: 縄目状の頭髪や同心円状の衣文の形式など、一見して日本の通例の仏像と異なる様式を示す。
sen.e: The knots in the hair and concentric rings on the robes make it immediately obvious that the style is different from that of traditional Japanese Buddhist statues.
The knots in the hair and concentric rings on the robes make it immediately obvious that the style is different from that of traditional Japanese Buddhist statues.
The knots in the hair and concentric rings on the robes make it immediately obvious that the style is different from that of traditional Japanese Buddhist statues.

sen.j: 奝然が宋に滞在中の985年、台州開元寺で作らせたもので、刻銘、納入品等の記載から、張延皎および張延襲という作者の名もわかっている。
sen.e: While Chonen was in China, he commissioned the piece at Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou and it is known from the inscriptions and writings on the objects inside that the names of its makers are Yanjiao ZHANG and Yanxi ZHANG.

In 985, while Chonen was in Song China, he commissioned the piece at Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou and it is known from the inscriptions and writings on the objects inside that the names of its makers are Yanjiao ZHANG and Yanxi ZHANG.

In 985, while Chonen was in Song China, he commissioned the piece at Kaiyuansi Temple in Taizhou and it is known from the inscriptions and writings on the objects inside that the names of its makers are Yanjiao ZHANG and Yanxi ZHANG.

sen.j: この釈迦像の模造は、奈良・西大寺 (奈良市)本尊像をはじめ、全国に100体近くあることが知られ、「清凉寺式釈迦像」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Nearly 100 imitations of this statue are known to exist around Japan including at Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and are referred to as "Seiryo-ji Temple-style Shaka statues."
Nearly 100 imitations of this statue are known to exist around Japan including at Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and are referred to as 'Seiryo-ji Temple-style Shaka statues.'
Nearly 100 imitations of this statue are known to exist around Japan including at Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and are referred to as 'Seiryo-ji Temple-style Shaka statues.'

sen.j: また、この像の胎内からは、造像にまつわる文書、奝然の遺品、仏教版画など多くの「納入品」が発見され、これらも像とともに国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: In addition, numerous pieces including documents relating to the statue's creation, items left by Chonen and Buddhist block prints were discovered within the abdomen of the statue and these have all been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.
sen.cmt: ・National Treasures: プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: In addition, numerous pieces including documents relating to the statue's creation, items left by Chonen and Buddhist block prints were discovered within the abdomen of the statue and these have all been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.

In addition, numerous pieces including documents relating to the statue's creation, items left by Chonen and Buddhist block prints were discovered within the abdomen of the statue and these have all been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.

sen.j: 納入品のうち「五臓六腑」（絹製の内臓の模型）は、医学史の資料としても注目される。
sen.e: Among these objects were internal organs (made of silk), which have gained a lot of attention as a valuable resource for the study of medical history.
Among these objects, 'five solid organs and six hollow organs' (a model of the internal organs made of silk), have gained a lot of attention as a valuable resource for the study of medical history.
sen.cmt: 「五臓六腑」→five solid organs and six hollow organs
sen.e: Among these objects, 'five solid organs and six hollow organs' (a model of the internal organs made of silk), have gained a lot of attention as a valuable resource for the study of medical history.

sen.j: その他、奝然の遺品としては、生誕書付（臍の緒書き）や手形を捺した文書なども発見された。
sen.e: Items left by Chonen include a birthday document (birth details) and documents with hand-prints.
Items left by Chonen include a birthday document (birth details) and documents with hand-prints.
Items left by Chonen include a birthday document (birth details) and documents with hand-prints.

sen.j: 木造阿弥陀三尊坐像－「起源と歴史」の項で述べた、棲霞寺の本尊である。
sen.e: Wooden sitting statue of Amida sanzon - The object of veneration of Seika-ji Temple referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.
Wooden sitting statue of Amida sanzon - The object of veneration of Seika-ji Temple referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.
Wooden sitting statue of Amida sanzon - The object of veneration of Seika-ji Temple referred to in the 'Origin and History' article.

sen.j: 源融の一周忌に当たる寛平8年（896年）に完成したと思われる。
sen.e: Believed to have been completed in 896 on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru.
Believed to have been completed in 896 on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru.
Believed to have been completed in 896 on the first anniversary of the death of MINAMOTO no Toru.

sen.j: 絹本著色十六羅漢像16幅－中国・北宋時代の羅漢像として唯一の遺品。
sen.e: 16 color on silk portraits of the 16 arhats - The only existing arhat image from Southern Song Period China.
16 color on silk portraits of the 16 arhats - The only existing arhat image from Northern Song Period China.
sen.cmt: ※幅→hanging scroll, width ですが、単に数と捉えました。Southern→Northern
sen.e: 16 color on silk portraits of the 16 arhats - The only existing arhat image from Northern Song Period China.

sen.j: 東京と京都の国立博物館に8幅ずつ寄託されている。
sen.e: Eight have been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and eight at Kyoto National Museum.
Eight have been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and eight at Kyoto National Museum.
Eight have been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and eight at Kyoto National Museum.

tit.cmt: ・Important Cultural Properties: 英辞郎 on the WEB
